org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa

Class SimulationEquivalence

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa.SimulationEquivalence

  • public class SimulationEquivalence
extends java.lang.Object
    Checks if two ω-automata with the same type of acceptance condition are simulation equivalent.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SimulationEquivalence.Result
      This class defines the result of the simulation equivalence test.

      Checks if two ω-automata with the same type of acceptance condition are simulation equivalent.
      static SimulationEquivalence.Result isEquivalent(FSA aut1, FSA aut2, java.lang.String name)
      Checks if two ω-automata with the same type of acceptance condition are simulation equivalent based on a simulation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimulationEquivalence

        public SimulationEquivalence()

    • Method Detail

      • isEquivalent

        public static SimulationEquivalence.Result isEquivalent(FSA aut1,
                                                        FSA aut2)
        Checks if two ω-automata with the same type of acceptance condition are simulation equivalent.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an ω-automaton
        aut2 - an ω-automaton
        Returns:
        true if aut1 and aut2 are simulation equivalent
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if (1) aut1 and aut2 have different alphabet types, (2) aut1 and aut2 have different label positions, or (3) aut1 and aut2 have different types of acceptance condition
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the default simulation cannot be applied to the two input automata

      • isEquivalent

        public static SimulationEquivalence.Result isEquivalent(FSA aut1,
                                                        FSA aut2,
                                                        java.lang.String name)
        Checks if two ω-automata with the same type of acceptance condition are simulation equivalent based on a simulation.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an ω-automaton
        aut2 - an ω-automaton
        name - the name of the simulation computation procedure
        Returns:
        true if aut1 and aut2 are simulation equivalent
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if (1) aut1 and aut2 have different alphabet types, (2) aut1 and aut2 have different label positions, or (3) aut1 and aut2 have different types of acceptance condition
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the default simulation cannot be applied to the two input automata
